question: 退く
sourceAnswer:
<read>どく</read>|<read>のく</read>:: to: step-aside/move-(i.e.-out-of-the-way)/make-way | resign/retire/quit/secede
<read>しりぞく</read>|<read>しぞく</read>:: to: step-back/move-back/retreat | withdraw-(from-the-presence-of-a-superior)/leave/exit | resign/retire/quit | concede
<read>ひく</read>:: to: move-back/draw-back/recede | lessen/subside/ebb/go-down-(e.g.-of-swelling) | resign/retire/quit
userAnswer:
<read>ひく</read>: move-back/draw-back/recede/fall-back/retreat | lessen/subside/ebb | resign/retire/quit
<tag><read>のく</read>|<read>どく</read>:uk:</tag> step-aside/move-out-of-the-way/make-way 
<tag><read>のく</read>uk:</tag>resign/retire/quit/secede
<read>しりぞく:</read> to: retreat/recede | withdraw | resign/retire
activeAnswer:
<read>ひく</read>: move-back/draw-back/recede/fall-back/retreat | lessen/subside/ebb | resign/retire/quit
<tag><read>のく</read>|<read>どく</read>:uk:</tag> step-aside/move-out-of-the-way/make-way 
<tag><read>のく</read>uk:</tag>resign/retire/quit/secede
<read>しりぞく:</read> to: retreat/recede | withdraw | resign/retire
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>retreat</kanji>, and the verb vocab version means <vocabulary>to retreat</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to withdraw</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to resign</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

You need <vocabulary>to retreat</vocabulary> because <reading>she re-zo</reading>ned (<ja>しりぞ</ja>) where you are standing. Now this is a no standing zone. Who is she? The re-zoner, duh.
